recipe.name: Cream Biscuits
recipe.description: An easy to make southern-style biscuit recipe
notes: Makes about 3 biscuits
instructions: Mix ingredients
Bake at 400F for 15mins

recipe.name: 65% hydration dough
recipe.description: Can be used to make Pita or New York Style Pizza
notes: Can be used to make pita, Pizza, calzone
Currently my favorite dough for same day
When cooking pita, a variation can be to add zaatar or sesame seeds and some olive oil before baking
instructions: Let the yeast bloom in the water first
Mix the rest of the ingredients
Knead for about 7 minutes
Let rest and rise for 2h
Divide into portions and let rest for a few minutes

recipe.name: No Knead Bread
notes: Recipe can also be used to make foccacia
instructions: bake 20mins inside of dutch oven
Then 20mins with lid opened

recipe.name: Burger Bun by Joshua Weissman
notes: notes...
instructions: Bake at 375F for about 16 to 18mins

recipe.name: Scones
notes: Add more sugar for sweet scones

recipe.name: Quick and Easy English Muffins
recipe.description: No-yeast English muffins mixed in one bowl and finished on the stovetop.

ingredients.name: vegetable oil
ingredients.quantity: about 1 teaspoon, for brushing the skillet

notes: Makes about 8 muffins at roughly 3 1/2 inches wide.
Split with a fork for the best nooks and crannies.
instructions: Place the Greek yogurt in a large mixing bowl, sift the self-rising flour over it, and stir with a spatula until the dough comes together.
Turn the dough onto a lightly floured surface and knead for a few minutes until smooth, shaping it into a flat ball.
Divide into 8 equal portions, roll each into a ball, and pat into 3 1/2-inch pucks about 1/2 inch thick; dust both sides with cornmeal if using.
Cover the shaped muffins with a towel and let rest for 15 minutes while you heat a skillet or griddle over medium-low.
Brush the hot skillet lightly with oil, add half of the muffins, cover, and cook for about 10 minutes without lifting the lid.
Flip the muffins, cover again, and cook another 10 to 12 minutes until golden and about 200F inside; transfer to a rack and repeat with the remaining dough.
Cool for at least 10 minutes, then split with a fork and toast if desired.

recipe.name: Rustic Mushroom Tart
recipe.description: Inspired from watching the movie Pig
notes: Idea, add some peppers such as jalapeno to the filling. Maybe right before oven instead of cooking it in filling so that it keeps some consistency and adds a bit of moisture to the filling.
instructions: Saute the mushroom and leeks in butter until much of the water content of them have evaporated
Add the chickpeas and keep cooking until some browning
take out and cool down before adding the ricotta and goat cheese

recipe.name: Galette des Rois or Almond Cream Cake
notes: notes...
instructions: let puff pastry rest at room temperature
in a bowl combine the sugar, the almond powder, the softened butter, one egg, salt, a pinch of baking powder and the almond extract
Spread the almond cream over the centre of the first puff pastry
leave about 2 inches of space from the edge
Beat an egg and brush it on the edge to help sealing the cake properly.
Place the second sheet of puff pastry over the cream pushing gently together the edges to seal them tight
Secure even more the filling you could use the blunt side of a knife to crimp up the edges, pushing gently down the pastry with a finger.
Brush the whole surface with the egg-wash once or twice.
With the tip of a knife, gently draw criss-cross lines and pierce the pastry at their intersections to allow the steam to escape.
Bake in a pre-heated oven at 200°C-400°F for about 30 minutes or until golden brown.

recipe.name: Pie Crust
instructions: freeze butter
mix all mixture
refrigerate

recipe.name: Focaccia (italian flat bread)
notes: Dont forget to season with enough SALT
Make deep enough holes and add salted water to the holes for Liguira style foccacia (from Salt, Fat, Acid, Heat Ep1)
I have often over cooked this bread. It's not bad, it just creates a very thick crust which is difficult to eat as a sandwich though.
instructions: mix dry ingredients
add olive oil
addd the yeast with warm water or (have the yeast already in the dry ingredients
10 minutes of kneading
40min to 1h to prove
oil and season in the bottom in the pan
garnish (thyme or rosemary) (cheese) (basil, tomato)
oil on top
salt and pepper on top
let prove for 45 minutes again
400F 200C 25 minutes

recipe.name: Thick Crust Pizza / Sicilian Pizza / Grandma Pizza
notes: IMPORTANT use non-convection oven or your pizza will be dry and overcooked on the outside
EXPERIMENT test parbaking the dough with sauce on top for a few minutes before adding toppings so that the crust cooks evenly
instructions: mix, pulse in a food processor, tomatoes, garlic, olive oil, anchovy, basil and a little salt
make pizza dough as normal recipes
let rise
put dough onto baking sheet and stretch
layer cheese onto the dough
put sauce, dotting on the pizza (not everywhere)
put toppings

recipe.name: Bon Appetit Grandma-style Pizza Dough
notes: notes...

recipe.name: Pizza dough
notes: Dont forget to season with enough SALT
dissolve yeast in water (gives better result than in dry ingredients)
instructions: mix dry ingredients
add olive oil
addd the yeast with warm water or (have the yeast already in the dry ingredients
10 minutes of kneading
40min to 1h to prove
oil and season in the bottom in the pan
garnish (thyme or rosemary) (cheese) (basil, tomato)
oil on top
salt and pepper on top
let prove for 45 minutes again

recipe.name: Tartine Pizza
recipe.description: A high hydration pizza with low manipulation of dough and bread dough as base
recipe.source: From the Chef Episode Tartine with Chad Robertson
notes: 100% hydration dough was used in the episode. Tried with 80% for first try.
Usual percent for dough, 2% salt, 0.5% yeast,
Should try with sourdough
Toppings tried are onions and lemon
Tomato, basil and cheese
instructions: mix dough. Periodically do the lift and fold several times before bulk fermentation
After bulk fermentaiton, form dough being careful to create tension on the dough
Put in fermentation baskets and refridgerate until ready
Put dough onto surface that will side into the oven
Poke dough like a focaccia, leaving it somewhat thick but slightly flattened
Put toppings and into the oven

recipe.name: Raisin Shortbread cookies
instructions: butter should be at room temperature
350 F till golden then cool
bake about 30 - 40 min
careful about too much vanilla and salt

recipe.name: Pandan Coconut Cookies
recipe.description: Quick pandan-flavored coconut cookies inspired by Filipino flavors.
instructions: Beat the butter and sugar until light and fluffy, about 3-5 minutes.
Mix in the eggs and pandan extract until well combined.
Sift together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt, then stir in the coconut flakes.
With the mixer on low, gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet just until combined.
Scoop dough with a 1 3/4 inch scoop onto a parchment-lined baking sheet.
Chill the dough for at least 1 hour.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 10-15 minutes, until the edges set.
Cool the cookies completely before serving.

recipe.name: Banana Bread
instructions: 400F for 55 - 60 mins
don\'t over mix

recipe.name: Baked Cheesecake
instructions: use 23cm cake tin
bake at 356F or 180C for 35 - 40 mins

recipe.name: Frozen vanilla custard / vanilla ice cream
instructions: mix egg yolks with sugar
heat liquid and mix with vanilla extract
temper egg mixture and slowly mix liquid
let cool in fridge or freezer
put in metal bowl
use a ice and salt bath to cool bowl and slowly freeze mixture
when consistency of soft serve, pour in container and freeze

recipe.name: Creme Caramel
recipe.description: Whole eggs creme caramel from Claire Saffitz
notes: made in 9in glass pie plate
instructions: Preheat oven to 350F
make dry caramel with the half (0.5 cup) sugar by slowly drizzling the sugar into a sauce pan
Add dry caramel to pie plate and let cool
heat the milk
blanche the eggs by mixing it with the other half (0.5 cup) sugar
temper the eggs with the heated milk and mix together
Mix the vanilla and salt into mixture
Add mixture to pie plate
Turn down oven to 325F
Put pie plate in hot water bath in oven and bake at 325F for 35-40mins

recipe.name: Bread Pudding
recipe.source: Inspired from the bread pudding we had at Cadet and recipe from Bon Appetit

ingredients.name: butter
ingredients.quantity: 1/4 cup for batter + extra for pan

notes: original recipe from BA calls for ½ large (2-pound) loaf challah bread, torn into 1½–2-inch pieces (about 8 cups)
instead I used french baguette since that was what I had on hand but I like the crust from it better
dried bread absorbs the custard better without disintegrating
instructions: tear bread into large pieces
start oven on lowest heat
put bread into oven to dry for 30 mins
finish on 300F if still not dry, take out and cool
in pan put milk and cream, granulated sugar and salt
add cinnamon and orange zest
bring to boil and take off heat to steep for about 30 mins
take out orange zest and cinnamon
add butter
mix milk mixture with beated eggs. Beat till light and fluffy
soak bread in custard for 3-12h
butter pans, pour bread and custard into pans
top with sugar and almonds
brush with butter
cook for 30-40min at 300F

recipe.name: Peach Parmesan Cobbler
notes: the peaches can be replaced by blueberries or strawberries or almost any fruit
Self Raising flour can be created by some baking powder and flour
instructions: cut peaches or fruit and add sugar (about 2 tablespoons) and a little water for a syrup
melt butter in the ramekin
make batter with the sugar, self raising flour and milk
add the grated parmegiano regiano to batter
put the batter into ramekin containing butter
add the fruit on top with the syrup

recipe.name: Biryani
instructions: cook chicken, yogurt, tomatoes, yogurt and biryani sauce in a pan
half cook rice till water is mostly gone
layer rice and rest in large pot
cover pot and cook at medium heat till heated up (indicated by vapour coming out of cover)

recipe.name: Holiday sausage stuffing
notes: ¾ cup (1½ sticks) unsalted butter, cut into pieces, divided, plus more
10 cups coarsely torn sourdough bread, dried out overnight
⅓ cup blanched hazelnuts
3 tablespoons olive oil
12 ounces hot or sweet Italian sausage, casings removed
2 onions, chopped
4 celery stalks, chopped
1 fennel bulb, chopped
2 tablespoons chopped sage
Kosher salt, freshly ground pepper
½ cup dry white wine
2 large eggs, beaten to blend
2 cups turkey or chicken stock (preferably homemade), plus more
instructions: break sour dough bread into corse pieces of about equal sizes
break italian sausage and brown in pan
take sausage out of pan without the grease
sweat onion and celery and sage
mix together with beaten egg and stock
deglaze pan with white wine and add butter to melt

recipe.name: Malaysian style soft boiled egg

instructions: Put egg with some tap water in pot
Pour boiling water until water is roughly 75-80C
Maintain 75C for 10mins
Cool egg with cold water and crack open in a bowl

boil the noodles and rinse with cold water

recipe.name: Banh Xeo
recipe.description: Vietnamese rice crepe filled with veggies, shrimp and meat

ingredients.name: Lettuce or green leaves or mustard leaves

notes: The rice flour batter cracked a bit too easily since it doesn't have any gluten. Try to add an egg in next time
This style of crepe can be soft or crispy
instructions: Cook the shrimp and meat before starting everything else
Make batter with rice flour, tumeric, coconut milk and water. It should have a light crepe batter texture
julienne the veggies
Prep the Nuoc Cham dressing by mixing the fish sauce, sugar, white vinegar, lime juice, chopped garlic and red chiles
Start cooking the crepes by pouring the batter in a medium light heat non-stick pan
Cover the pan to cook the top of the crepe
Add the shrimp, meat and veggies

recipe.name: Vietnamese Fresh Rolls
notes: The lettuce should be on the layer next to the rice paper wrapper
instructions: assemble

recipe.name: Vietnamese Fish Sauce (Nước Chấm)
notes: The recipe from https://www.hungryhuy.com/vietnamese-dipping-fish-sauce-recipe-nuoc-cham-nuoc-mam-cham/ was a bit too watery
instructions: Add lime or lemon juice in increments until you like how it tastes. A good guide is it should taste like lemonade/limeade.
Add fish sauce in small increments until you like how it tastes. It should be a little strong since it goes on unseasoned food.
Top with garlic and chilies and serve.

recipe.name: Mentsuyu (Noodle Soup Base)
notes: can be used in multiple dishes such as somen, udon, soba noodles
can be used cold or hot. As a base for a soup or a dipping sauce
You can store in the refrigerator up to a month
instructions: Gather all the ingredients.
In a medium saucepan, add sake and bring it to a boil over medium high heat. Let the alcohol evaporate for a few seconds.
Add mirin and soy sauce.
Then add kombu and katsuobushi.
Cook on low heat for 5 minutes.
Turn off the heat and set aside until cool down.
Pass the mixture through a fine sieve and now Mentsuyu is ready to use.
Save the drained katsuobushi and kombu to make homemade Furikake (rice seasoning)

recipe.name: Inari Age and Aburaage
recipe.description: A deep fried seasoned tofu that can be used in kitsune udon

ingredients.name: Peanut oil or any oil for deep frying

notes: the aburaage can be used in a variety of dishes such as
Takikomi Gohan (mixed vegetables and meat cooked in rice)
Oden (seafood hot pot)
Ginger rice (rice cooked with ginger and dashi)
inari sushi
Kitsune udon
Simply eaten with rice
instructions: Bring oil to 160C or so
Fry the outside to golden brown while leaving the inside somewhat less cooked
Keep in a closed container to let steam and prevent the aburaage from hardening
Mix the sugar, dashi and soy sauce in a pan and add aburaage to it
put a drop lid or aluminium foil on top
cook till liquid is reduced

recipe.name: Inari Age and Aburaage
recipe.description: A deep fried seasoned tofu that can be used in kitsune udon

Takikomi Gohan (mixed vegetables and meat cooked in rice)

inari sushi
Kitsune udon

Keep in a closed container to let steam and prevent the aburaage from hardening

recipe.name: Oyakodon / Chicken and egg rice bowl
notes: Used bokchoy and green onion instead of onion
Don't over fry chicken at beginning. Better to simply follow recipe
instructions: Combine dashi, mirin, sake, soy sauce and sugar in a bowl or a liquid measuring cup.
slice chicken into medium pieces
put onion into pan

once chicken is cooked add beated egg

recipe.name: Tuna Mayo Onigiri

recipe.name: Thai duck red curry
instructions: debone duck
cut pineapple and tomatoes
optionally add shallots and garlic and cook till fragrant before adding curry paste
add oil and curry paste to pan and cook till fragrant
add coconut milk
add tomatoes and pineapple
add kaffir leaves

add seasoning (sugar and salt)
add duck
add basil leaves

recipe.name: Chicharon
recipe.description: fried pork rinds
notes: Do the cooking outside on a portable stove. The splattering is very hard to clean and prevent.
I like to keep the fat on the skin. This means that they won't keep for as long as regular chicharon since fat gets rancid faster than the gelatin in pure skin.
instructions: Boil the pork skin thoroughly. Maybe at least 15mins. The fat needs to be almost cooked through
Add a bit of oil to get it started when frying. It will eventually render enough fat to fry but can burn before if no oil is added
Fry at medium high heat. On my stove that's currently 6-7
Keep an eye on it because it takes a while to cook but can quickly burn

recipe.name: Pad Ka-Prao Moo (Thai Basil Pork)
notes: Can be served topped with a fried egg
instructions: chop garlic, shallots and chillis and pound with mortal and pestle
fry the aromatics until fragrant
add the ground pork
add the sauces
cook until the sauce is lightly reduced
add the thai basil

recipe.name: Pulled Pork
instructions: marinate pork shoulder with mixed ingredients
marinate overnight or over several days
put in over with vinegar and a side dish of water for steam
slow roast at 325-350F for several hours (3-5h)

recipe.name: Glazed Pork Chop

ingredients.name: Good thick Bone in pork chop

notes: notes...
instructions: heat up the pan till almost smoking
brown one side of the pork chop
turn over and add glaze
10-15mins in 375F oven

recipe.name: braised pork belly chinese
instructions: cut green onions and ginger
cut the pork belly into pieces
put in pot of cold water and bring to a boil
let boil for a little bit and get rid of scum
drain water
make seasoning
put pork, seasoning, ginger and green onions into pot
add water
cook

recipe.name: Octopus confit

instructions: clean octopus
put oil into big pot and start heating lightly to jumpstart
put octopus into pot with thyme, garlic and crushed red pepper
cook for 1h or 2h
char in a hot pan

recipe.name: BA's Best Shrimp Scampi
notes: If the sauce breaks, add water to get it back
Eats really well with bread or my favorite rice!
Almost as good as Giovanni's on the North shore of Oahu but not quite there
Keep the shells to add even better flavor but makes eating inconvinient
I also added some soy sauce to add some salty flavour to the sauce
instructions: Microplane or crush about 2 garlic into the shelled shrimps with olive oil and salt
Then let marinate for about 30mins
Thinly slice about 2 garlic cloves. Doesn't need to be too fine
Cook the shrimp in a pan on a medium heat to lightly sear the shrimp without cooking through
Take shrimp out of pan
Cook sliced garlic with some red pepper flakes until fragrant
Deglaze with white wine and cook out alcohol
Add butter to emulsify the sauce to finish the sauce
Add back shrimp
Finish it off with chopped parsley

recipe.name: Pantry chickpea pasta
notes: keep some of the chickpeas to plate at the end before crushing the rest
instructions: Chop garlic and cook
Add chili flakes
Add chickpeas and cook
Add rosemary
Add lemon juice
Crush the chickpeas

instructions: boil the pasta
pan fry the garlic, olive oil and anchovies
add tomato paste
add water
add pine nuts and raisins
add sugar
add pasta to sauce

pass over spaetzle maker into boiling water with salt
get the ones that rise to the top out of the water

add other ingredients

recipe.name: Rigatoni a la Vodka
instructions: add butter to some extra virgin olive oil
add blanched garlic or chopped garlic
add crushed chilli
add a little vodka
add cherry tomatoes and don't over cook them
add canned san marzano tomato sauce
add cream and chicken stock
remove from heat
season with some salt and pepper
add some chopped basil
add pasta
garnish with ricotta and olive oil and basil

recipe.name: Spaghetti Carbonara
instructions: boil pasta
wait a bit before pan frying the guanciale
beat 2 eggs and parmesan cheese
Don't add oil to pan
heat pancetta in pan
add pasta to pan
take off heat
add eggs and parmesan cheese mixture to pasta

notes: notes...
instructions: crisp up proscuitto in a pan with olive oil
brown mushrooms in pan with olive oil be careful not to crowd

simmer till reduced
cook pasta and finish cooking in sauce

add butter

recipe.name: Ricotta Dumplings
instructions: mix ricotta and parmesan
season the mix before adding flour

form the dumplings
blanch the asparagus

instructions: cut tofu in thick slices like scallops
blot cut ends in corn starch
heat pan with oil
put tofu in pan
turn over once seared on one side

recipe.name: Leek and Potatoes Soup
recipe.description: Can be served hot or cold. Also known as a vichyssoise if served cold
notes: To clean the leeks. Cut in half and soak in water to let the grit fall down to the bottom of the bowl of water.
Keep the potatoes in water
instructions: sweat the leeks with butter
add chicken stock and potatoes
cook till potatoes are soft
once cooked, blend the soup
add cream

recipe.name: Jacques Pépin's Maman's Cheese Soufflé
recipe.description: Quick and easy version of cheese soufflé

Add nutmeg, ground black pepper and salt to the roux
Beat eggs and add cooled down roux to the eggs
Add chives and grated cheese
Butter baking pan and dust with grated parmesan

Bake at 375F for 35 to 40 mins

recipe.name: Classic Gratin Dauphinois

ingredients.name: slightly waxy potatoes such as yukon gold

notes: only a light dusting of Parmesan cheese, not much is needed. It can also be omitted from the French Cooking Academy's recipe
The french cooking academy's recipe calls for brushing the pan with garlic as well as butter to give a little garlic flavour
Jacques Pepin's recipe calls for pre boiled potatoes so that the potatoes are softer when cooked
Try it with sweet potatoes
instructions: add black pepper and nutmeg to the cream
slice the potatoes
layer the potatoes and the cream
light dusting of parmesan on top
cook 300F for 90 to 120 mins

recipe.name: Stick to your Bones Chicken Soup
notes: any other kind of veggies can be added
instructions: brown chicken a bit
roast the chicken bones if there are any (optional)
take chicken out
sweat onion and garlic
add cut carrots and any other veggies
add water and some sugar
add back chicken
let boil for 1-2h
take chicken out and shred it
about 10-20mins before done add washed rice and sweet potatoes

recipe.name: Chicken and Andouille Sausages Gumbo
recipe.source: Chef Isaac Toups, of Toups Meatery
notes: notes...
instructions: Season the chicken with salt, black pepper, and one tablespoon of grapeseed oil. Broil it until slightly charred and golden, about 10 minutes, and set aside.

Heat a thick bottomed 4-quart Dutch oven over medium. Add the oil and flour and, using a whisk, stir constantly, taking care not to allow any to splash and burn you, until the roux has turned dark brown (the color of a bar of Hershey's chocolate is about right), about 25 minutes.

Add the garlic, celery, jalapeño, bell pepper, and onion and cook for one minute. Add the beer to deglaze, then add the stock, thyme, bay leaves, and 1 teaspoon black pepper. Stir slowly and continuously until the gumbo is back to a simmer, then add the chicken thighs and the sausage. Bring to a simmer and cover. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 3 hours. Gumbo should thick but not like gravy. Season with cayenne and serve with cooked rice. Top with scallions and enjoy!

recipe.name: Shrimp Mango Dumplings
notes: notes...
instructions: 1. For the dumplings, rinse the shrimp in cold running water. Pat them dry. It's super important that there isn't a lot of liquid in the dumpling mix, otherwise, it'll cause the skin to break while cooking. Peel and devein the shrimp. (You can keep the shells and use them to make stock if you want.) Rinse again. Chop the shrimp until it's almost paste-like.
2. Mix the garlic, lime juice, lime zest, ginger, pepper, soy sauce, salt, and cornstarch together in a small bowl. Pour the liquid mixture in with the shrimp. Add the mango and cilantro.

3. To wrap the dumplings, take a store-bought dumpling skin and put a scoop of about ½ tablespoon of the shrimp filling into the center of the skin. Dip your finger into the bowl of water and then wet the one side of the skin, around the filling. Then fold the skin over and press together until all the air pockets are pushed out. Crimp the skin edge together. If you need the skin to bond together more, use more water as an adhesive.

4. To fry, heat about 2 tablespoons of oil in a non-stick pan on high heat. Make sure the oil is nice and hot before you start cooking. Place the dumplings bottom-side down. Place as many dumplings in the pan as possible without overcrowding the pan. Fry for a few minutes until the bottom is a nice even golden brown. Bring down the heat to medium. Then, pour some water in the plan and cover so the dumplings can steam.

5. Steam the dumplings for about 3-4 minutes, until the dumplings are cooked through and the water has evaporated. Uncover the dumplings and let the bottoms crisp up a bit more. Take them off the stove.
6. To make the apricot dipping sauce, combine all sauce ingredients and mix well.
7. Garnish the dumplings with cilantro and scallions. Serve with the apricot dipping sauce.

recipe.name: Kale Salad with Wheat Berries, Parmesan, Pine Nuts, and Currants
recipe.source: Salad Dinner Book by Jeanne Kelley

ingredients.name: kale (ribs removed, leaves roughly chopped into 1in pieces
ingredients.quantity: 2 bunches (each about 12 ounces) / Once cut about 12-14 cups

notes: cooking of farro and prep of the nuts, dressing and kale can be done concurrently
We used dried currants when we made the recipe and it worked very well
instructions: Cook the farro in a medium pot of rapidly boiling salted water until just tender, about 30min. Drain the farro and let cool completely. (The farro can be cooked up to 1 day ahead; cover and refrigerate)
In a large bowl, combinethe olive oil, 3 tablespoons lemon juice, vinegar, honey, and salt and whisk to blend. Add the kale and stir to coat well. Let the salad stand 1h or overnight.
Mix the salad well, adding additional lemon juice to taste, Stir in the farro, cheese, pine nuts and currants. Season the salad with freshly ground black pepper and serve.
